episodes.description:
In this episode, Melanie and Cory discuss their experiences growing up in a polygamous community while reflecting on the show Sister Wives. They delve into themes of mental health, body image, modesty, parenting dynamics, and the emotional struggles faced by the women in polygamous relationships. The conversation highlights the complexities of their upbringing, the societal pressures surrounding mental health, and the challenges of navigating relationships within a polygamous family. They also touch on the importance of healing and the need for open discussions about mental health in their community.

Takeaways

Melanie and Cory were raised in a polygamous church in Utah.
They are watching Sister Wives for the first time and sharing their perspectives.
Mental health issues are prevalent in their community, with high antidepressant usage.
There is a significant amount of shame surrounding mental health discussions.
Body image and modesty are heavily scrutinized in their upbringing.
Parenting dynamics in polygamous families can lead to confusion and stress for children.
The women in polygamous relationships often walk on eggshells around each other.
Judgment about modesty and lifestyle choices is common in their community.
The importance of healing and finding support is emphasized.
They encourage open discussions about mental health and personal experiences.

Finding joy in small moments can aid in recovery.
Self-care is essential during the healing process.

Gratitude can shift perspective during difficult times.

episodes.title: Sister Wives Season 19 Tell All Pt 4 Recap
episodes.description:
In this conversation, Melanie and Corey discuss their experiences growing up in a polygamous cult, the dynamics of polygamous relationships as portrayed in the show Sister Wives, and the emotional and psychological impacts of such a lifestyle. They reflect on their healing journeys, the importance of laughter, and the challenges faced by women in polygamous families. The discussion also touches on the roles of men, the significance of appearances, and the misleading narratives often presented in polygamous contexts. In this conversation, the complexities of love, relationships, and the dynamics within the AUB (Apostolic United Brethren) community are explored. The discussion delves into the nature of courtships, the implications of the priesthood, and the flawed commitments that arise in polygamous marriages. The speakers reflect on Cody's justifications for his actions and the hypocrisy that permeates his narrative, highlighting the emotional struggles faced by the women involved. The conversation explores the themes of intuition, situational awareness, and the complexities of relationships within a polygamous context. The speakers discuss the power of women's intuition, the importance of setting boundaries, and the journey of self-discovery and empowerment after leaving a restrictive environment. They reflect on the dynamics of relationships, the impact of past experiences, and the need for open communication and respect. The discussion also touches on the challenges of navigating gray areas in relationships and the significance of personal growth and self-worth.

episodes.description:
**Unedited Original Version** 

We didn't realize the video we uploaded to our main page had been edited by AI. The way it cuts out and cuts us both off was very frustrating. We decided to upload the original version to members only. Thank you again for your continued support. 

Summary

In this episode, Melanie and Corey discuss the complex dynamics of family relationships within the Apostolic United Brethren (AUB) community, particularly in the context of grief and loss. They reflect on their own experiences growing up in a polygamous family and how these experiences shape their perspectives on healing and family interactions. The conversation delves into the roles of parents and children during times of loss, the impact of Cody's absence, and the emotional toll of family separation. They emphasize the importance of doing healing work to foster better relationships and love within families.

Takeaways

The importance of healing work for better family dynamics.
Children often take on responsibilities in family gatherings.
Cody's absence has led to a disconnect with his children.
Grief can reveal the true dynamics of family relationships.
Polygamous families often experience separation as they grow.
Cody's romanticization of grief reflects his need for control.
Mothers play a crucial role in nurturing their children during grief.
Tim's balanced perspective offers a contrast to Cody's behavior.
Children's perspectives highlight the impact of parental actions.
Healing and love within families require ongoing effort.

episodes.title: Why I went public. My content is now being stolen
episodes.description:
I made my 1st video in 2023. This is why I went public. I am now being bullied by the same "creator" (I use that term very losely) I have refused interviews & information to this person. Because they can't obtain information they have resorted to bullying, harassment and theft. They can't create their own content so they have resorted to stealing & using mine without my consent. They are literally using my exact words in their content. Please take note. I appreciate the support I have received as I have put my story out there so publicly. Online bullying is a real thing & I am experiencing it currently.

episodes.title: Welcome Back * Trigger Warning* This video contains content about SA
episodes.description:
In this episode, Melanie discusses her decision to take a break from recording due to the potential hurt and offense her stories may cause to her family who are still part of the polygamous cult she grew up in. She shares that despite receiving some negative feedback, she has also received messages from women who have found her stories helpful and empowering. Melanie then delves into the topic of sexual abuse, which is prevalent in the polygamous community. She shares her own experiences of abuse and the lack of support she received from her family. Melanie emphasizes the importance of speaking out about abuse and bringing it into the light to stop the cycle of abuse.
Keywords
cult, polygamous, abuse, sexual abuse, empowerment, healing, family, support
Takeaways
Melanie took a break from recording to consider the potential hurt and offense her stories may cause to her family who are still part of the polygamous cult she grew up in.
Despite receiving negative feedback, Melanie has also received messages from women who have found her stories helpful and empowering.
Sexual abuse is prevalent in the polygamous community, and Melanie shares her own experiences of abuse and the lack of support she received from her family.
Melanie emphasizes the importance of speaking out about abuse and bringing it into the light to stop the cycle of abuse.

The Empowering Impact of Sharing My Experiences
Sound Bites

"I owe him an apology and I literally have bruises."
"I was so angry that I had been made to believe my entire life that it was my fault."

episodes.title: Deconstructing Religious Beliefs
episodes.description: In this episode, Melanie discusses her personal journey of deconstructing her beliefs and spiritual belief systems. She shares how events and experiences in her childhood shaped her beliefs, and how she spent her adult life deconstructing and questioning those beliefs. Melanie highlights the courage it takes to deconstruct religious beliefs, as it challenges the foundation of one's identity and faith. She shares her experiences within the polygamist community and the conflicts she faced, including questioning her own worth and the role of women in the community. Melanie also discusses the importance of finding inner strength and learning tools to process emotions and navigate crises of faith. In this conversation, Melanie discusses her journey of deconstructing her beliefs and leaving the polygamous community she was raised in. She shares how she became an independent thinker and realized that her partner did not want her to succeed. She also talks about the challenges she faced with her child's health issues and her husband's infidelity, which led her to question her faith. Melanie emphasizes the importance of deconstructing beliefs and questioning religious teachings, and she encourages others to have the courage to explore their own beliefs.

episodes.title: What is in a word?
episodes.description:
In this episode, Melanie discusses the controversial topic of cults and shares her personal experience of growing up in a fundamentalist Mormon church. She explores the definitions and characteristics of cults, including charismatic leaders, ideological purity, conformity and control, mind-altering practices, isolation and love bombing, us vs them mentality, apocalyptic thinking, and the dedication of time and energy. Melanie reflects on the impact of these characteristics on her life and the challenges of leaving a cult. She emphasizes the importance of understanding and compassion when discussing cults and the need to question and deconstruct beliefs. In this conversation, Melanie discusses her experiences growing up in a cult-like religious community and the process of deconstructing her faith. She explores themes of hierarchy, fear-based control, the definition and use of the word 'cult', freedom of speech, and personal accountability in rebuilding oneself.

Takeaways

Cults can be defined by characteristics such as charismatic leaders, ideological purity, conformity and control, mind-altering practices, isolation and love bombing, us vs them mentality, apocalyptic thinking, and the dedication of time and energy.
Growing up in a cult can involve experiences of shame, guilt, and pressure to conform to strict beliefs and practices.
The us vs them mentality perpetuated by cults can create a sense of superiority and separation from those outside the group.
Apocalyptic thinking and the belief in an impending cataclysmic event are common in many cults.
Cults often require members to dedicate a significant amount of time, energy, and resources to the group, sometimes to the detriment of their own lives, interests, jobs, and families. Growing up in a cult-like religious community can involve experiencing a hierarchy of needs, where some individuals benefit from the hard work of others.
Fear-based control is a common characteristic of cults, with members being taught that they will lose their family, standing with God, and eternal life if they do not comply.
The word 'cult' has a negative connotation but accurately describes certain religious communities. It is important to use words responsibly and be accountable for the impact they have.
Society needs to balance freedom of speech with accountability for the way information is received and portrayed.
Deconstructing faith and religion is a process of breaking down beliefs and rebuilding oneself according to personal values and experiences.
Personal accountability is crucial in the process of rebuilding oneself after deconstructing faith, allowing for intentional growth and the creation of the best version of oneself.

episodes.title: Start the Healing
episodes.description:
Summary

In this episode, Melanie shares her personal healing journey, starting with a pivotal moment in her life that led her to explore opportunities for healing and finding magic in hardships. She discusses her experience with manifestation and the power of writing notes to herself as a tool for transformation. Melanie also opens up about her struggles with postpartum depression, insecurities, and the challenges of being in a polygamous marriage. She highlights the importance of seeking healing outside of traditional religious teachings and shares how various healing modalities, including therapy and plant medicines, have played a significant role in her journey. Melanie emphasizes the ongoing nature of healing and the importance of embracing triggers as opportunities for growth.

Takeaways

There are opportunities for healing and finding magic in hardships.
Manifestation can be a powerful tool for transformation.
Seeking healing outside of traditional religious teachings is possible and beneficial.
Continuing the healing journey requires exploring different modalities and embracing triggers as opportunities for growth.
